Articles.Content: Come on, I don't wanna start all over again! XD

Yes. There are no significant changes to the source code so new versions are compatible with older saves unless stated otherwise.

Significant code changes will also only occur between major versions (like 0.20.1 to 0.21.0) so have no fear, if it works in 0.20.0, it will 99% assuredly work in 0.20.1.

I don't see any reason why they wouldn't be; 0.20.1 is simply bugfixes, they haven't added any vast new features. Besides, 0.18.4 was compatable with 0.18.2 saves, as well as 0.19.1 with 0.19's, so this update shouldn't break saves either.
They should be, but there might be strange behavior with things on Mun surface because the reverted the texture.

They should be, but there might be strange behavior with things on Mun surface because the reverted the texture.

I checked out both my Mun missions, and both exhibited the same behaviour: they initially seemed to hang several metres above the surface, then after a few seconds everything reset and the landers were on the surface exactly as they should be.
I've carried over a 18.0 save into 20.0 without problems (after adapting mod parts and modules to the new config formatting).

Another smooth update. All ships and flights from save moved over no problem. This game probably has many updates to come. So for now, Mod Free = Hassle Free updates.

Noticed something a little different about the way to download this update. I had to go to my KSP Profile and use the link near the bottom of the page. The last update I just went through the normal store link.
I didn't have any issues with my saves from 0.19.1 through to 0.20.1

How exactly do you transfer saves?

You just copy the folder that contains is called what you called it at the beginning, before you started your game, from the old save folder to the new save folder.
